New Chapter HEADING

export class ToggleContent {
  constructor() {
    this.container = $('#element-content-container');
    this.parent = null;
    this.errors = null;
    this.el_ignore_class = 'ignore';
    this.el_error_class = 'error-el';
    this.components = {}; // To store dynamically imported modules

    this.componentNames = [
      'code',
      'markdown',
      'jsonTable',
      'table',
      'tooltip',
      'file',
      'contact',
      'carousel',
      'asciiMath',
      'tab',
      'copy',
      'image',
      'embed',
      'equation',
    ];

    this.init(); // Initialize dynamic imports and method assignments
  }

  async init() {
    // Dynamically import modules based on component names
    for (const name of this.componentNames) {
      const path = `./component/${name}.js`; // Construct path based on the name
      try {
        const module = await import(path);
        this.components[name] = module;

        // Dynamically assign reverse and render methods if they exist
        if (module.reverse) {
          this[`reverse${this.capitalize(name)}`] = module.reverse;
        }
        if (module.render) {
          this[`render${this.capitalize(name)}`] = module.render;
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.error(`Failed to load module: ${path}`, error);
      }
    }
  }

  capitalize(str) {
    return str.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + str.slice(1);
  }

  callAllReverse() {
    // Call the `reverse` method for all components that have it
    for (const [name, module] of Object.entries(this.components)) {
      if (typeof module.reverse === 'function') {
        console.log(`Calling reverse for ${name}`);
        module.reverse();
      }
    }
  }

  callAllRender() {
    // Call the `render` method for all components that have it
    for (const [name, module] of Object.entries(this.components)) {
      if (typeof module.render === 'function') {
        console.log(`Calling render for ${name}`);
        module.render();
      }
    }
  }
}

<sn><md>^To solve the equation \( 2x + 3 = 2 \):

1. Subtract 3 from both sides:
   \[
   2x = 2 - 3
   \]
   \[
   2x = -1
   \]

2. Divide both sides by 2:
   \[
   x = \frac{-1}{2}
   \]

So, the solution is \( x = -\frac{1}{2} \).</md></sn>
